meanings.definition: The action of providing food or drink for someone.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed serving meals to the homeless at the shelter.
meanings.sent2: The waiter brought out a serving of pasta for the customer.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was serving its owner by bringing dead mice as gifts.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a serving of warmth in a cold world.
meanings.sent5: The serving of cake was so generous that everyone had seconds.

meanings.definition: The quantity of food or drink served at one time.
meanings.sent1: He requested a large serving of fries with his burger.
meanings.sent2: The buffet offered a variety of servings for the guests to choose from.
meanings.sent3: The mountain of ice cream was a serving fit for a king.
meanings.sent4: The serving of soup was overflowing the bowl.
meanings.sent5: The serving of lemonade was refreshing on a hot day.

meanings.definition: The act of helping or assisting someone.
meanings.sent1: Her serving in the community center made a difference in many lives.
meanings.sent2: The serving of advice she gave was invaluable to her friend.
meanings.sent3: The robot's serving in the household chores was a time-saver.
meanings.sent4: His serving in the project ensured its success.
meanings.sent5: The serving of support from her family meant everything to her.

meanings.definition: The act of working for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: His serving as a mentor helped guide the new employees.
meanings.sent2: The serving of the employees was crucial for the company's growth.
meanings.sent3: The ants' serving in the colony was a well-organized effort.
meanings.sent4: The serving of the volunteers was commendable during the event.
meanings.sent5: The serving of the team was essential for the project's completion.
